assignments.name: Template Assignment
assignments.intro:
Assignments are useful when students need to upload documents, provide information, or submit media. They should be appropriate in scope and provide instructions that express clear expectations that will be transparent through use of applicable rubrics.

When designing your assignments, create opportunities for authentic assessment. This means the assignments provide opportunities for critical thinking, problem-solving, reflection, and application of essential skills in a context that is meaningful to the student.

Instructions

This assignment addresses course outcome(s) X and module learning objective(s) X [linked to syllabus]. [Provide clear instructions, both for how the students should complete and format the assignment as well as information such as the naming conventions they should use and the file format required for grading and expected response length.]

Make sure settings are correct for file upload or online text, number of files allowed, notifying graders upon submission, and restrictions/conditional release.

Activity completion: set to "Student must submit this activity to complete it," with expected completion date if desired.

assignments.name: Quiz 1 Work Upload Assignment
assignments.intro:
Instructions

This assignment is for you to upload your work for this Quiz. Number each problem and be neat with your work.

Work must be uploaded before the due date of the Quiz to receive credit. Quiz grades may be penalized if no work is shown on a problem or uploaded. Please make sure your image is legible, otherwise you may still occur penalties.

Name the file as LastName_Quiz#Work (Example: Smith_Quiz1Work).

You may submit your file as a PDF, DOC, TXT, GIF, JPEG, or PNG.


For adopting instructors:

  1. Make sure settings are correct for file upload or online text, number of files allowed, notifying graders upon submission, and restrictions/conditional release.
  2. Activity completion: set to "Student must submit this activity to complete it," with expected completion date if desired.
